intro: Litsea lecardii, commonly known as the Mexican privet, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Central America and parts of Mexico, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and white, clustered flowers that appear in the spring. Its fruit is a small, dark berry that contains several seeds. Litsea lecardii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
